author: chianca
title: The Catalyst School | LATAM
description: En LATAM, existe una barrera lingüística para que las comunidades locales se informen sobre Catalyst, ya que el inglés no se habla habitualmente en la región

f6_assessments.q0: Esta propuesta es excelente y se corresponde al 100% con los objetivos del reto. La Catalyst School ya es un hito para la comunidad de Cardano, es un proyecto de alto valor que ayuda a mucha gente nueva que tiene el diseño para entrar en el proceso de Catalyst y no sabe qué hacer. Hasta entonces, creo que, si no todas, la mayoría de las actividades de la Escuela se hacían en inglés, lo que supone una barrera para los que no hablan el idioma. Ofrecer talleres, con diferentes temas, desde cómo ser CA, vCa, proponente, qué es Catalyst, etc., en portugués y español facilitará sin duda la adhesión de nuevos miembros de América Latina, y con ello favorecerá enormemente al continente, ya que se busca el desafío. Entre las propuestas que evalué, esta es una de las que más posibilidades tiene de tener un impacto positivo inmediato, porque los resultados comenzarían a surgir desde el momento en que se realicen los talleres, en los próximos 2 fondos. Además de beneficiar al continente, beneficiaría a nuestro sistema en su conjunto, ya que traería nuevos miembros, lo que también está relacionado con un reto del f6, si no me equivoco, era algo así como "Value on boarding", que pretendía traer nuevos miembros a la comunidad y comprometer a los que ya forman parte de ella.
f6_assessments.q1: Sin duda, el equipo involucrado será capaz de impulsar con éxito este proyecto. Pienso esto porque, como dije antes, la Escuela Catalizadora ya es una realidad, tuvo varias propuestas lanzadas en el f6, y la mayoría de ellas financiadas. Participan activamente en los procesos de financiación, ejecutando sus proyectos, sus miembros tienen una marcada presencia en los eventos de la comunidad, como los Ayuntamientos, y además cuentan con canales de comunicación activos (youtube, telegram, discord, etc.), a través de los cuales pueden articularse. . De este modo, creo fielmente que el proyecto está en buenas manos, basta con que los nuevos miembros implicados tengan también un alto nivel de compromiso. En cuanto al guión, nos dicen exactamente qué se haría, cuándo y cómo; cuáles son los objetivos para el tiempo total (24 eventos para 2 fondos); qué gastos serían necesarios para que estas cosas se hagan realidad, de forma detallada y precisa. Sabemos quién trabajaría con qué, durante cuánto tiempo y también la tarifa salarial por hora. Sabemos qué temas se pretenden tratar en cada taller, aunque siempre existe la posibilidad de que esta hoja de ruta se modifique ligeramente en función de los comentarios de la comunidad. El guión es tan preciso que también tenemos una noción del tiempo, es decir, en qué semana tendría lugar cada actividad. Volviendo a hablar de la parte financiera, encontré el valor justo, aunque elevado, justifican por qué se pide este valor y cómo se utilizaría según las necesidades del proyecto. Por estas razones, creo que el equipo aclara muy bien 1) lo que se hará 2) cómo se hará 3) cuándo se hará 4) por cuánto se hará, por lo que no encontré espacio para una crítica constructiva.
f6_assessments.q2: Sabemos muy bien qué va a pasar y quién en qué orden, por lo que es fácil seguir y monitorear el proyecto. Creo que sería interesante que la Escuela pusiera a disposición informes de lo que está pasando, de los pequeños resultados que está obteniendo y los mostrara al resto de la comunidad, para que las personas que no hablan portugués/español puedan estar al tanto de la situación. Es positivo que expongan con detalle cuáles serían sus métricas de éxito, es decir, cómo podemos entender si el proyecto está consiguiendo lo que pretende. También sería interesante que algún miembro de la comunidad participara en los talleres (naturalmente, alguien que hable los idiomas que se trabajan aquí), o incluso que comentara durante un Ayuntamiento cómo se está incorporando el proyecto. Creo que para que tenga éxito también es necesario que hagamos un seguimiento de la publicidad, que podamos obtener datos sobre cómo se está difundiendo este proyecto, porque la clave del asunto aquí es desmitificar Catalyst para aquellos que no conocen o conocen y no entienden. Y esto sólo se puede hacer con una fuerte publicidad. Sin embargo, todo lo que he dicho aquí son sugerencias, creo que el equipo ha sido lo suficientemente cuidadoso como para proporcionarnos contenido para monitorear y realizar la auditabilidad.

f6_assessments.q0: La propuesta encaja bien con el objetivo del desafío, al proponer una forma en la que los miembros del catalizador que hablan portugués y/o español puedan inscribirse para participar en talleres, en los que puedan debatir entre ellos sobre diferentes etapas del catalizador, facilitando así un aumento en el nivel de usuarios latinoamericanos de Cardano a través de un debate entre individuos de diferentes ramas del ecosistema de Cardano, sin las dificultades generadas por no dominar el idioma inglés. Según los organizadores del proyecto, una de las medidas de éxito del proyecto es el número de usuarios que participan en estos talleres, siendo un factor de gran importancia para proporcionar un debate más amplio que permita a los usuarios que están empezando a tener una mejor idea de qué camino dentro del ecosistema Cardano prefiere seguir, y cuál es la mejor manera de hacerlo, y para los veteranos será una oportunidad para "inspirar a los novatos" y aprender aún más de otros veteranos presentes allí. Por lo tanto, la propuesta ve el crecimiento sesgado en el desafío como una evolución de los miembros actuales, pero no como una expansión para la gente fuera de Cardano, pero debido al alto nivel de organización presente en la página del catalizador y en el gitbook (https://chianca. gitbook.io/cs-latam), y la simplicidad en la base del proyecto, que justifica su bajo costo, hace que el proyecto latam sea muy plausible, realista y en línea con los objetivos del desafío.
f6_assessments.q1: Aunque no hay presentación de las personas involucradas en el proyecto en la página del catalizador, todo está presente en la página del gitbook (https://chianca.gitbook.io/cs-latam/school-yard/latam-town-hall) y el equipo aparentemente presenta la calificación necesaria para cumplir con el proyecto. Además, el funcionamiento del proyecto está bien explicado a excepción de cómo funcionarán las clases, sé que será un proceso conjunto entre los propios miembros para que intercambien conocimientos entre ellos, e incluso si está de acuerdo que generará una mejora en la calidad de los usuarios ya registrados en Cardano, No creo que de la forma en que está planteado el proyecto (centrado en la mejora de los usuarios registrados) atraiga una cantidad considerable de usuarios al ecosistema de Cardano, pero sí que mejorará el nivel de los usuarios existentes, y en cuestión de control financiero, todos los gastos están muy bien documentados y también se está solicitando una financiación muy asequible para el tiempo que dure el proyecto hasta que necesite más financiación nueva(2 fondos). funcionamiento del proyecto directamente en la página de la propuesta.
f6_assessments.q2: En cuanto al seguimiento, todo está ya publicado en la página de la propuesta, incluyendo en qué se gastará el dinero recibido, y cómo funcionarán los eventos hasta 6 meses después de la financiación, y aunque se dice que el calendario predeterminado puede cambiar según los comentarios y necesidades de la comunidad, si la página de gitbook(https://chianca.gitbook.io/cs-latam/) se actualiza con frecuencia, será fácil seguir el funcionamiento del proyecto.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal meets the objectives of the challenge, because encourage members of the community to be more involved in future funds. The curriculum will be replicated from other regions and will include teaching materials for various subjects related to the catalyst project. A more informed community will be more likely to participate more actively in the next fundraising round if it is aware of the catalyst's goals. The success metrics presented are in full alignment with what this challenge seeks. Furthermore, I believe that this will also contribute to attracting new members once they fully comprehend the many advantages of the blockchain ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: With respect to the feasibility of this proposal, we have two critical factors in mind, previously successful implementations of the team on a global scale and a passionate LATAM community who are willing to participate and deliver value. Therefore, I am confident that the team will have the skills and experience necessary to complete the project successfully. Regarding the budget, the team makes a breakdown of items clearly understandable for the role they will have in the school, as well as for complementary professional roles such as marketing, development, and project management.
f6_assessments.q2: Everything is very well detailed when it comes to the project's auditability. Several aims of this project have already been identified, namely to teach ecosystem members even more about many subjects relevant to the Catalyst project, and how this will be done: through workshops, classes, the preparation of classroom materials, and... They explain in detailed what will happen according to the passage of time, both in weeks and what they intend to have acting with a certain amount of months. We are also told the metrics used to measure the proposal's success, making it easier to track the community's progress. Similarly, we have detailed how each part of the requested fund will be divided, and each part is also very detailed.

f6_assessments.q0: The catalyst school (LATAM) aims to onboard new catalyst proposers and community advisors by teaching weekly lessons in Portuguese and Spanish. This idea will directly bring in new proposers and other catalyst community members who were previously discouraged due to a language barrier. I believe that this proposal is a huge benefit to the cardano community because new members will join and bring their ideas and visions for the blockchain. Thus, catalyst will grow even more with new proposals that can then improve the cardano ecosystem for everyone. I appreciate that the proposers thought to openly publish the documents they teach so that their project will live on beyond just the courses they teach. (score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers gave brief information about their experience. Despite the information being brief, I do believe that they will be successful in implementing this proposal because they have past experience with catalyst and as education professionals -- the two most important background knowledges related to this proposal. 

Based on the plan provided, I do think that the proposal will be successful because it follows a simple, yet impactful process: onboard new members and teach weekly lessons on the catalyst process that will guide them through the entire process from start to finish. They have requested a fair amount of money given the scope of the project. Additionally, they have good plans for the website that will be the home for the project. (score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q2:
Based on the information provided, the proposers have provided sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal. Not only have the proposers listed the weekly plan for classes that the cardano community can audit, but they also gave many key performance indicators that can be used to track the project. 

My only question for the proposers is how will they know a proposal was directly influenced by their program? Is there a way to accurately track these metrics that were listed as measures of success? Otherwise, I believe that this proposal is perfectly auditable. (score given: 5)

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal fits a notable portion of the Challenge settings without a doubt. It is clearly stated in their intentions to; 'Introduce Project Catalyst, How to Propose, How to become a CA and How to become a vCA'. Which will result in at the very least, an influx of proposals from this region. Increasing awareness through education of the opportunities that Project Catalyst provide will most likely unearth a large number of developers, entrepreneurs and think tanks whom were previously oblivious. Add to that, the format of education is a direct and proven copy of the global Catalyst School, who has developed numerous materials on how to submit and create quality proposals. One huge factor that should be taken account also, they will provide all these education in their local language. A considerable undertaking which will add more intellectual wealth to Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no clear explanation regarding their experience in this proposal. Had to go through various related proposal and their GitBook to formulate their web of stellar individuals. Would have been way easier if the members were clearly stated in the proposal. They have also been through the tutelage of already established Cardano Communities, such as; Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Town, Catalyst School etc. This is partly reflected in their clear budget, complete with numerous action plans. Compared to what they tend to achieve, the number of proposer and the duration of work, their budget is a bit low. Again, confused how soo many hi-performing individuals are always submitting low numbers. There seems to be something off with the general Project Catalyst process. Their timetable though is on point because it considers that education is gradual process. Unfortunately, there are no risk and challenge assessment. Being a pioneer will always bring risk, the simplest would be, 'During these covid times and pressing economic situation in Latin America, will they even care on building on Cardano?'
f6_assessments.q2: A very clear roadmap is provided, complete with milestones and their respective actions plans. Numerous KPI's can be viewed but will most likely be challenging to measure for there are no numerical targets.  Problem statement and solution on their are own are strong and can traced as the source material of this proposal, even though they are not aligned 100% to one another.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal stated that setting up a Catalyst School LATAM will be a place to onboard local communities and enhance the impact of catalyst in Latin America. The Catalyst School LATAM will provide similar services as the Catalyst School, but in the Portuguese and Spanish languages, with the aim to onboard  new members and help improve their skills in whichever way they decide to engage with catalyst- as a Proposer, Community Advisor, veteran community advisor, etc) . Having read through the proposal, these facts above all show that the challenge is addressed effectively.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is made up of Veteran Advisors, Proposal mentors, education professionals, active catalyst community members. They are capable of implementing the proposal successfully. The plan includes topics like Introduction to Catalyst, a basic website in Portuguese and English language, school session and workshops(in Spanish and Portuguese), 12 sessions of workshop and weekly sessions for 12 months.  All these facts, among others, will lead to a successful implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is clear showing 12 months of detailed work; the number of CAs that join, number of voters and number of referees will all make auditing easy. The budget is well detailed and comprehensive. for effective auditing.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to create a Catalyst shool for Spanish and Portuguese speaking community. I strongly agree the proposal is impactful because the proposal would:
- onboard new members from Spanish and Portuguese speaking region for Project Catalyst and Cardano community
- help new members improve their skills while engaging in Project Catalyst as proposers, CAs, vCAs (or without any specific roles)
As we see The Catalyst School is enhancing the impact of Catalyst completely by improving the contribution of all its players and roles. This proposal's success will be a big contribution to the growth of Cardano ecosystem in Spanish and Portugese-speaking region with a 'similar services as The Catalyst School' (as the proposal mentions). 
I recommend the proposal should add link of The Catalyst School (for readers who may not know).
f6_assessments.q1:
I agree the proposal is feasible because of the following points:
- The content of the School and basic website is articulated clearly
- Plan is sensible and conductible. We can see clearly what content is being done in School and how to do  in the plan.
- Budget is outlined and broken down clearly into identifiable items which are based on steps in the plan.
However, I recommend the proposal should have more information for fully feasible, such as:
-Type and number of the team members
-Evidence of the team's experience and skills relevant to the successful implementation.
-Challenge and risk relevant to the successful implementation.
I would like to know the reason why the basic website will be in Portuguese and English instead of Portuguese and Spanish? (Maybe it is a typing mistake?)
I also would recommend the School should add 'Current news' into the main topic (in Spainish and Portuguese of course) to update 'news' (from Town Hall for example).
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap with milestone and time horizon are set clearly, make the proposal easy to be tracked the progress of the implementation. The targeted problem and solution are articulated clear understandable. Additionally, the work's result will be shown directly in the School, easy to see and easy to audit.
However, I would like to know:
- How many community members who get involved with the Catalyst School LATAM
- How many proposers joining the sessions and workshops
- How many  CAs, vCAs joining the sessions and workshops
- How many  of 1-to-1 supports provided to community members
- How many new referees, new voters
does the proposers expect as the success metrics of the proposal? 
The expected numbers should be given for fully auditability of the proposal.
In summary, I rate auditability with a score of 4.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets out a clear problem that is logically related to the needs of the challenge. In the sense that it facilitates the integration of a new audience into Catalyst by overcoming the problem of language barriers. This aim to expand the community of the Latam ecosystem in Catalyst but also benefit to the whole community by allowing education and process learning. And these objectives correspond with the KPIs provided, which are clearly explained. Moreover, this proposal is able to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no precise explanation of the members who drafted the proposal, but this can be accepted in the sense that this solution seems to be initiated with the Catalyst school group, which is an active and recognised community in the ecosystem and is part of a more general plan to develop the Latin community. Supported by Catalyst Swarm and Eastern Town Hall. Links are also provided to other proposals related to these initiatives. The plan allows for a detailed understanding of the whole process, which allows for a great deal of transparency. The budget seems coherent and realistic and itself well justified by explanations. Only the risks are not really addressed. But overall all the necessary elements are provided to justify the success of its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: All the elements provided in this proposal, the plan, the success metrics, the budget breakdown, are already very transparent and clear. The KPIs make sense and allow for the identification of quantitative objectives that the community can refer to. All the content and the resources used will be published in a public Git repository with an Open Source license.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal for a localized Catalyst school supports the effort to grow Cardano in Latam since it will open participation for a wider audience in the region. The proposal seems to be priorizing the portuguese development (about a third of Latam's population) but to have the intention of developing spanish too with less intensity. (e.g.: basic website is proposed in english and portuguese only)
This proposal's impact is enhanced when considered toghether with other 3 proposals submitted by collaborating teams.
f6_assessments.q1:
- A reasonable and detailed roadmap is being layed out, timeline, budget and KPI's provide a good picture of how the team plans to succeed in implementing the proposal.
- The team behind the proposal are trusted and experienced community members who have the capability to execute this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
- The KPI's proposed to measure success do not have specific goals, therefore it will be impossible to use them to asess the level of success of the exersice.
- All the deliverables are easy to verify so the coummunity should be able to audit execution easily.

solution: La Escuela Catalyst | LATAM será un lugar para embarcar a las comunidades locales y mejorar el impacto de Catalyst en América Latina.
experience: Asesores veteranos y mentores de propuestas, profesionales de la educación, miembros muy activos de la comunidad de Catalyst desde los primeros Fondos y mucho más.
